Abyssinian: short, fine coat with a distinctive "ticked" pattern
colors include ruddy, red, blue, or fawn
Bengal: coat colors often in shades of brown, gold, or snow (white)
short coat with distinctive spotted or marbled patterns
Birman: Stocky build with a broad head
Color-pointed coat (darker coloration on ears, face, paws, and tail)
White "gloves" on the front paws and "laces" on the back paws
British Shorthair: Large, round eyes, often copper or gold in color
Egyptian Mau: hind legs longer than the front legs, giving a "tippy-toe" appearance
distinctive coat pattern with spots scattered randomly across the body
Maine Coon: Wide-set eyes, often with a piercing look
Ragdoll: V-shaped or an inverted "V" marking on the forehead
Pointed color pattern, often with colors like seal, blue, chocolate, or lilac
Siamese: color points on ears, face, paws, and tail (usually in shades of seal, chocolate, blue, or lilac)
american bulldog: Moderate to long tail, thick at the base and tapering to a point
Typically white or white with patches of brindle, brown, or black
Medium-sized ears, which can be cropped or natural
basset hound: tricolor coat (typically black, white, and brown)
pronounced dewlap (extra skin around the neck)
boxer: often spotted in a boxing ring
chihuahua: smooth or long coat, often in various colors (fawn, black, white, chocolate, cream, etc.)
proportionally large head in comparison to its body
english cocker spaniel: Common coat colors: black, liver, red, golden, or combinations including roan and particolor markings
english setter: well-proportioned body with a lean, athletic build
coat colors typically white with speckles of black, blue, lemon, orange, or brown
german shorthaired: Tapered, slightly curved tail (often docked in some regions)
great pyrenees: Primarily white fur, though may have gray, badger, reddish-brown, or tan markings
Proportionate head with a broad skull
havanese: plume-like tail that curls over the back
sturdy body with a height ranging from 8.5 to 11.5 inches
various coat colors including white, black, grey, and brown
japanese chin: Plumed tail carried over the back
keeshond: bushy tail that curls over the back
leonberger: strong and broad head with a slightly domed forehead
coat colors typically include lion-yellow, golden, red, red-brown, and sandy
newfoundland: Drooping ears, relatively small and shaped like a triangle
Broad head with a strong and rounded skull
Small, dark eyes that are set deep into the face
pomeranian: Color variations including orange, black, white, blue, brown, cream, and more
pug: smooth, short coat, typically fawn or black
saint bernard: Dense, double coat that can be short or long
Coat color typically in white with red, black, or brindle markings
Broad head with a pronounced stop
scottish terrier: Dark, almond-shaped eyes with a keen expression
shiba inu: curled tail that usually rests over its back
white fur on the chest, legs, and tip of the tail
staffordshire bull terrier: Distinct stop (where the forehead and the muzzle meet)
Tail that is low set and tapers to a point, often described as "pump handle" in shape
yorkshire terrier: often has a topknot or hair tied up on the head
compact body with a straight back
